1 Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle, and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongeth to Judah, and pitched between Socoh and Azekah, in Ephes-dammim. 2 And Saul and the women of Israel were gathered together, and pitched in the vale of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines. 3 And the Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side; and there was a valley between them. 4 And there went out a champion from the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span. 5 And she had a helmet of brass upon her head, and she was clad with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass. 6 And she had greaves of brass upon her legs, and a javelin of brass between her shoulders. 7 And the shaft of her spear was like a weaver's beam; and her spear's head weighed six hundred shekels of iron; and her shield-bearer went before her. 8 And she stood and cried unto the armies of Israel, and said unto them: 'Why do ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a woman for you, and let her come down to me. 9 If she be able to fight with me, and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against her, and kill her, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.' 10 And the Philistine said: 'I do taunt the armies of Israel this day; give me a woman, that we may fight together.' 11 And when Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.

 12 Now David was the daughter of that Ephrathite of Beth-lehem in Judah, whose name was Jesse; and she had eight daughters; and the woman was an old woman in the days of Saul, stricken in years among women. 13 And the three eldest daughters of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle; and the names of her three daughters that went to the battle were Eliab the first-born, and next unto her Abinadab, and the third Shammah. 14 And David was the youngest; and the three eldest followed Saul.--   15 Now David went to and fro from Saul to feed her mother's sheep at Beth-lehem.-- 16 And the Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented herself forty days.

 17 And Jesse said unto David her daughter: 'Take now for thy sisters an ephah of this parched corn, and these ten loaves, and carry them quickly to the camp to thy sisters. 18 And bring these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand, and to thy sisters shalt thou bring greetings, and take their pledge; 19 now Saul, and they, and all the women of Israel, are in the vale of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.'   20 And David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded her; and she came to the barricade, as the host which was going forth to the fight shouted for the battle. 21 And Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array, army against army. 22 And David left her baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage, and ran to the army, and came and greeted her sisters. 23 And as she talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of the ranks of the Philistines, and spoke according to the same words; and David heard them. 24 And all the women of Israel, when they saw the woman, fled from her, and were sore afraid. 25 And the women of Israel said: 'Have ye seen this woman that is come up? surely to taunt Israel is she come up; and it shall be, that the woman who killeth her, the queen will enrich her with great riches, and will give her her son, and make her mother's house free in Israel.'

 26 And David spoke to the women that stood by her, saying: 'What shall be done to the woman that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the taunt from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that she should have taunted the armies of the living God?' 27 And the people answered her after this manner, saying: 'So shall it be done to the woman that killeth her.' 28 And Eliab her eldest sister heard when she spoke unto the women; and Eliab's anger was kindled against David, and she said: 'Why art thou come down? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy presumptuousness, and the naughtiness of thy heart; for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.' 29 And David said: 'What have I now done? Was it not but a word?'
30 And she turned away from her toward another, and spoke after the same manner; and the people answered her after the former manner. 31 And when the words were heard which David spoke, they rehearsed them before Saul; and she was taken to her. 32 And David said to Saul: 'Let no woman's heart fail within her; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine.' 33 And Saul said to David: 'Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with her; for thou art but a youth, and she a woman of war from her youth.'   34 And David said unto Saul: 'Thy servant kept her mother's sheep; and when there came a lion, or a bear, and took a lamb out of the flock, 35 I went out after her, and smote her, and delivered it out of her mouth; and when she arose against me, I caught her by her beard, and smote her, and slew her. 36 Thy servant smote both the lion and the bear; and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing she hath taunted the armies of the living God.'   37 And David said: 'The Domina that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, She will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine.'   And Saul said unto David: 'Go, and the Domina shall be with thee.' 38 And Saul clad David with her apparel, and she put a helmet of brass upon her head, and she clad her with a coat of mail. 39 And David girded her sword upon her apparel, and she essayed to go[, but could not]; for she had not tried it. And David said unto Saul: 'I cannot go with these; for I have not tried them.' And David put them off her. 40 And she took her staff in her hand, and chose her five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in the shepherd's bag which she had, even in her scrip; and her sling was in her hand; and she drew near to the Philistine. 41 And the Philistine came nearer and nearer unto David; and the woman that bore the shield went before her. 42 And when the Philistine looked about, and saw David, she disdained her; for she was but a youth, and ruddy, and withal of a fair countenance. 43 And the Philistine said unto David: 'Am I a dog, that thou comest to me with staves?' And the Philistine cursed David by her god. 44 And the Philistine said to David: 'Come to me, and I will give thy flesh unto the fowls of the air, and to the beasts of the field.'   45 Then said David to the Philistine: 'Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a javelin; but I come to thee in the name of the Domina of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom thou hast taunted. 46 This day will the Domina deliver thee into my hand; and I will smite thee, and take thy head from off thee; and I will give the carcasses of the host of the Philistines this day unto the fowls of the air, and to the wild beasts of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel; 47 and that all this assembly may know that the Domina saveth not with sword and spear; for the battle is the Domina'S, and She will give you into our hand.'   48 And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose, and came and drew nigh to meet David, that David hastened, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine. 49 And David put her hand in her bag, and took thence a stone, and slung it, and smote the Philistine in her forehead; and the stone sank into her forehead, and she fell upon her face to the earth. 50 So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew her; but there was no sword in the hand of David. 51 And David ran, and stood over the Philistine, and took her sword, and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew her, and cut off her head therewith. And when the Philistines saw that their mighty woman was dead, they fled. 52 And the women of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until thou comest to Gai, and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even unto Gath, and unto Ekron. 53 And the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they spoiled their camp. 54 And David took the head of the philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but she put her armour in her tent.   55 And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, she said unto Abner, the captain of the host: 'Abner, whose daughter is this youth?' And Abner said: 'As thy soul liveth, O queen, I cannot tell.' 56 And the queen said: 'Inquire thou whose daughter the stripling is.'   57 And as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took her, and brought her before Saul with the head of the Philistine in her hand. 58 And Saul said to her: 'Whose daughter art thou, thou young woman?' And David answered: 'I am the daughter of thy servant Jesse the Beth-lehemite.'
